channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dogecoin rebounds 3% as Elon Musk backs down from feud with Trump
item.description: The Tesla CEO said that he regrets some of his posts about the president last week.

item.title: Appeals court sides with Trump, allows tariffs to stay in place
item.description: A federal appeals court agreed Tuesday to let the government keep collecting President Donald Trump’s sweeping import taxes while challenges to his si...

item.title: How Daily Harvest’s CEO Embraced the Power of Partnership with its Chobani Deal
item.description: Inc. speaks with Daily Harvest CEO Ricky Silver about joining the Chobani brand family. He also settles the argument once and for all: smoothie bowl o...

item.title: It’s Time to Get Serious About Training Your Staff on AI. This Survey Shows Why
item.description: As AI changes the modern workplace, business leaders need to make it a real part of their companies, says a new survey.

item.title: Trump’s hush money conviction heads to New York’s federal appeals court
item.description: President Donald Trump’s quest to erase his criminal conviction heads to a federal appeals court Wednesday. It’s one way he’s trying to get last year’...

item.title: Starbucks’ new game plan to roll out AI chatbots at cafes could serve as a ‘litmus test’ for the industry, analyst says
item.description: The coffee chain will deploy the OpenAI-powered tech in 35 stores before rolling it out nationwide in the fall.

item.title: Cathie Wood’s ARK Invest predicts SpaceX will be worth $2.5 trillion by 2030—and the key to Elon Musk’s Mars ambitions will be Starlink
item.description: That valuation would represent a 38% annualized return from SpaceX’s $350 billion funding round in December.

item.title: The global oil and gas industry is ‘deteriorating,’ says top credit ratings agency
item.description: Fitch lowered its 2025 rating of the global oil sector from "neutral" to "deteriorating."

item.title: 11 Better Ways to Praise Employees Besides Saying ‘Great Job’
item.description: Highlighting specific things people do well shows you’re paying attention, and that has a more lasting positive impact.

item.title: ‘Buffy’ star Sarah Michelle Gellar hates writing big checks—she cuts coupons, researches gas prices before filling up, and stares at purchases ‘for days’ before buying
item.description: Other stars like Keke Palmer and Ed Sheeran prefer low-cost lifestyles, setting budgets, crashing at people’s houses, and living below their means.

item.title: Suspects in Manhattan crypto kidnapping, torture case plead not guilty
item.description: Two crypto investors pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to charges they kidnapped and tortured an Italian man for his Bitcoin in an upscale Manhattan tow...

item.title: Disney and Universal sue AI firm Midjourney over copyright infringement
item.description: Disney and Universal have filed a copyright lawsuit against popular artificial intelligence image-generator Midjourney on Wednesday, marking the first...

item.title: Why Companies with More Female Board Members Have Better Workplace Safety
item.description: A new study says companies with more women on their boards—and men who listen to what they say—are better at keeping their employees safe from workpla...

item.title: Space and defense tech firm Voyager raises $382.8 million in IPO
item.description: Voyager Technologies raised $382.8 million in its U.S. initial public offering, the space and defense tech company said on Tuesday, amid a global rush...

item.title: Inflation Rises Slightly in May, but Prices Remain Volatile
item.description: A key government statistic shows rising costs for groceries and imported goods were muted by drops in categories like new cars and gas.
